content: >http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/Afghanistan+victory+unlikely+says+manual/1352137/story.html The new Canadian anti-insurgency manual points out "heuristic" opportunities to understand the Afghan "meme" as an opportunity to arrive at a state where the insurgency is "managed" in a way that fosters continued social advances and political development. Warriors are encouraged to develop an understanding of the motivations and aspirations of insurgents so as to work toward ameliorating conditions which engender them. Food for thought in the thinking man's army. Even the PM Steve Harper is telling allies in the US press it's a no-win situation. Meanwhile,three more glorious dead. heuristic - trial and error meme - culture transmitted by birth managed - your guess, but no 15 percent The minds that put the kibosh on the Kaiser and hung out Hitler's washing, can't see any way to whup the Taliban. I'm not surprised they saw a way to start a war in Afghanistan - see the previous points about hanging and kibosh.

content: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: >http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/Afghanistan+victory+unlikely+says+manual/1352137/story.html The new Canadian anti-insurgency manual points out "heuristic" opportunities to understand the Afghan "meme" as an opportunity to arrive at a state where the insurgency is "managed" in a way that fosters continued social advances and political development. Warriors are encouraged to develop an understanding of the motivations and aspirations of insurgents so as to work toward ameliorating conditions which engender them. Food for thought in the thinking man's army. Even the PM Steve Harper is telling allies in the US press it's a no-win situation. Meanwhile,three more glorious dead. heuristic - trial and error meme - culture transmitted by birth managed - your guess, but no 15 percent The minds that put the kibosh on the Kaiser and hung out Hitler's washing, can't see any way to whup the Taliban. I'm not surprised they saw a way to start a war in Afghanistan - see the previous points about hanging and kibosh. Yeah I read it the manual. Was only one page though. BIG LETTERS too. Went something like this. SURRENDER TO ALL!!!! There's nobody to surrender to. If 'surrendering' was the criterion of victory we won. The jails are full of the 'surrendered'. The manual points out the standard war mind won't 'cut it' in Afghanistan. Don't know about you, Anbar, but I get really offended that some young Canadians have lost their lives for what is now being described as a 'management exercise'. This sort of thing should be figured before the killing starts.

This sort of thing should be figured before the killing starts.

content: quote: Originally posted by mrmixitup: quote: Originally posted by SUNLINER81: Aside from your bombastic prognostication, what really is your point?... Respectfully, SUNLINER81 Agreed. Since the meaning in the real manual actually matches the US Counter insurgency manual and is what resulted in the Sunni's switching to support the US in Iraq against Al Queada I have to ask what the point is as well.

title: New Canadian Insurgency Manual

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: quote: Originally posted by Anbar7: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: >http://www.calgaryherald.com/news/Afghanistan+victory+unlikely+says+manual/1352137/story.html The new Canadian anti-insurgency manual points out "heuristic" opportunities to understand the Afghan "meme" as an opportunity to arrive at a state where the insurgency is "managed" in a way that fosters continued social advances and political development. Warriors are encouraged to develop an understanding of the motivations and aspirations of insurgents so as to work toward ameliorating conditions which engender them. Food for thought in the thinking man's army. Even the PM Steve Harper is telling allies in the US press it's a no-win situation. Meanwhile,three more glorious dead. heuristic - trial and error meme - culture transmitted by birth managed - your guess, but no 15 percent The minds that put the kibosh on the Kaiser and hung out Hitler's washing, can't see any way to whup the Taliban. I'm not surprised they saw a way to start a war in Afghanistan - see the previous points about hanging and kibosh. Yeah I read it the manual. Was only one page though. BIG LETTERS too. Went something like this. SURRENDER TO ALL!!!! There's nobody to surrender to. If 'surrendering' was the criterion of victory we won. The jails are full of the 'surrendered'. The manual points out the standard war mind won't 'cut it' in Afghanistan. Don't know about you, Anbar, but I get really offended that some young Canadians have lost their lives for what is now being described as a 'management exercise'. This sort of thing should be figured before the killing starts. Thank you for coming to realization and feeling what everybody else feels. I for one do get ****ed off everytime I hear someone say the wars we are fighting will be known as the forgotten wars....or that we are fighting for no reason. Everyday I wake up I think about the guys who didn't come home with me. Everyday I think about this war. But to hear people simply state that this is for nothing....my brothers did not die for nothing...they died for the Iraqis and they died for the Afghanis. They died for them to have freedom. Many were thankful, few were not. Also to to comment on your standard war mind. War changes everyday. We adapt and we overcome. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford
